panels.description: Status returned from the `/readyz` health status endpoint. Unhealthy reasons include beacon node problems, charon p2p problems, or validator client problems.
panels.title: Health Status

panels.description: Successful cluster duty percentage by type over the whole time range
panels.title: Cluster Duty Success(%)

panels.description:
Average beacon node score for the whole time window. The score is a combination of:
 - **errors**: the ratio or errors returned by the beacon node 
 - **latency**: how fast or slow the beacon node is responding


The performance of the Beacon node is critical to the performance of the validators and therefore rewards.

targets.expr: (clamp(app_monitoring_readyz{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"} == 1 OR app_monitoring_readyz{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"} == 4 OR app_monitoring_readyz{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"} == 5 OR app_monitoring_readyz{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"} == 6, 1, 1) OR on() vector(0))

panels.title: Beacon Node Score

panels.description:
Information about the charon cluster.

- **Network**: The blockchain network 
- **Operators/Nodes**: The number of operators or nodes or peers in the charon DV cluster.
- **Threshold**: The minimum number of participating nodes (also quorum).
- **Validators**: The number of validators added to the cluster, each validator is staking 32 ETH.

targets.expr:
( 1 * app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", cluster_network="mainnet"} )
or 
( 2 * app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", cluster_network="goerli"} )
or
( 3 * app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", cluster_network="sepolia"} )
or
( 4 * app_version{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", cluster_network="gnosis"} )

panels.title: Cluster Info

panels.description:
This panels shows any health checks that are failing. See <add link> for help troubleshooting.  

Note the different severities:
- **info**: Only informational, might not be an actual problem.
- **warning**: Performance is degraded, operator intervention only required if this persists for a long time.
- **critical**: Significant problem, validators probably not operation at all. Immediate operator intervention required.
panels.title: Failing Health Checks

panels.description:
- **Peer**: The peer's name (inferred from their *charon-enr-private-key*)
- **You**: â­ï¸ is this local charon node
- **Connected**: Whether you are currently connected to this peer.
- **Direct**: Whether the connection is *direct* (ðŸ‘) or *relay* (ðŸ‘Ž) 
- **Latency**: The time messages take to travel to/from the peer.
- **Version**: The version of the peer's charon node
- **Supported**: Whether the peers charon version is supported/compatible or not.
- **Uptime**" The duration since peer was restarted.
- **ðŸš§Attest**: Number of attestation duties missed in the time window.
- **ðŸš§Propose**: Number of block proposal duties missed in the time window.
- **ðŸš§Other**: Number of other duties missed in the time window.

targets.expr:
(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", duty="attester"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", duty="attester"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", duty=~".*proposer"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", duty=~".*proposer"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

(
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_missed_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", duty!~"(proposer|attester)"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
/
    sum(increase(core_tracker_participation_expected_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer", duty!~"(proposer|attester)"}[$__range])) by (peer) 
) OR on() vector(0)

panels.description:
Type of connections to each peer in the cluster during the time window:
 - ðŸŸ¢ Green: Direct connection (this is the preferred)
 - ðŸŸ¡ Yellow: Indirect relay connection (this is ok if only temporary)
 - ðŸ”´ Red: No connection to peer (this is a problem)

See https://docs.obol.tech/docs/charon/networking#external-p2p-network

panels.description:
Status and balance of each validator by public key with links to beaconcha.in.

If present, the "â—ï¸Peer Exits" column indicate the number of peers that submitted partially signed exits for each validator.
panels.title: Validators

panels.description:
Warning (w) and error (e) logs grouped by topic. 

Occasional warns and errors are normal, but a significant increase indicate problems that require operators to investigate by looking at the actual logs entries.
panels.title: Warning(w) and Error(e) logs (per $interval)

panels.description:
- **Peer**: The peer's name (inferred from their *charon-enr-private-key*)
- **You**: â­ï¸ is this local charon node
- **Connected**: Whether you are currently connected to this peer.
- **Direct**: Whether the connection is *direct* (ðŸ‘) or *relay* (ðŸ‘Ž) 
- **Latency**: The time messages take to travel to/from the peer.
- **Uptime**" The duration since peer was restarted.
- **ClockDiff**: Difference between local and peer's clock time. More than 2s is bad.
- **ðŸš§Attest**: Number of attestation duties missed in the time window.
- **ðŸš§Propose**: Number of block proposal duties missed in the time window.
- **ðŸš§Other**: Number of other duties missed in the time window.

panels.description: Which operators are having a growing number of relay registrations failures, indicating there may be a risk to an upcoming MEV block production opportunity. Be conscious that absence of an operator from this list may mean their MEV registration is working, or it may mean it is not enabled at all and thus not failing.

panels.description: Duties that was successfully broadcast to the Beacon Node, but that was never included on-chain. This could be due to broadcasting too late (too slow), but it could also just be to aspects of consensus layer out-of-our-control. See https://eth2book.info/bellatrix/part2/incentives/rewards/#remarks.
panels.title: ðŸ’¥ Broadcasted duties never included on-chain (per $interval)

targets.expr:
clamp_min((clamp(app_monitoring_readyz{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"} == 1 OR app_monitoring_readyz{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"} == 4 OR app_monitoring_readyz{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"} == 5 OR app_monitoring_readyz{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"} == 6, 1, 1) OR on() vector(0))
*
(
    (
0.5 * (1.0 - 10*(sum(increase(app_eth2_errors_total{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"}[$interval])) / (sum(increase(app_eth2_latency_seconds_count{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"}[$interval]))))) OR on() vector(0.5)
    )
    +
    (
        0.5 * (1.0 - clamp_max(histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(app_eth2_latency_seconds_bucket{cluster_name="$cluster_name",cluster_hash="$cluster_hash",cluster_peer="$cluster_peer"}[$interval])) by (le)),1))
    )
), 0)
